author: Special Correspondent
text:
In spite of speculation about its uneasy relationship with the ruling front in Puducherry, the top leadership of Bharatiya Janata Party maintains that it is keen to continue to work with ruling All India NR Congress in the upcoming Assembly polls.

A senior BJP leader pointed out that Union Minister M.Venkaiah on Monday reportedly said, “Actually we want to work with AINRC. Let the schedule of election be announced and then we will sit together to discuss and decide.”

Hopeful of alliance

Even though Chief Minister N. Rangasamy made remarks against the Union Government for failing to release adequate funds to the UT Government, the BJP leaders in Puducherry unit are still hopeful of formation of alliance with ruling AINRC.

BJP unit president V.Saminathan said, “Our party became stronger with more than 75,000 members. The people want the schemes of Modi Government to be replicated in the Union Territory.

The Union Government pays adequate attention and care towards the welfare of people in the Union Territory. We are much hopeful of getting more number of seats in the coming Assembly polls.”

It was in 2014, that AINRC became a part of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP)-led alliance, and its candidate R. Radhakrishnan emerged victorious trouncing senior Congress leader V. Narayanasamy. Following which, M.Visweswaran was made as a nominated MLA to the Puducherry Legislative Assembly.

The BJP leader also said his party would invite applications from aspirants who seek to contest election on party tickets from Wednesday.
title: BJP top leadership keen to work with AINRC
